title: Question for rioter, Am i allowed to do this?
body:
Can i delete Pool party dravens sound file? 

I really get frustrated and extremely toxic when someone has the poolparty draven skin. I dont like listening to him saying ''HA HAHA HA HAHA'' and ''TOO EASY'' and the auto splash noise every half second. It really frustrates me 

Am i allowed to?

replies.body:
We don't recommend modifying the game files, as it is against the [Terms of Use](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse). If you're getting frustrated with specific game sounds for specific skins I recommend either turning those sounds down in-game, or blasting some awesome tunes to keep you focused. I know that when I'm really trying to focus, I listen to a few different playlists and I feel I'm able to perform better by doing so.

Let me know if you have any questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=yFi87BJk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-11T23:56:03.804+0000)
>
> 
> Let me know if you have any questions.

Wouldn't modifying the sound files fall under the same category as "custom models and artwork"?

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/cIfEodbz/d/5kx4F7VE

Quoted below:

> [{quoted}](name=cluvie,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=5kx4F7VE,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-09-28T18:09:18.385+0000)
>
> 
> For now, custom models and artwork sit firmly in a “use-at-your-own-risk” category, but we’re keeping an eye on them. We can’t optimize for assets we don’t develop, and if they do become a concern in the future (ie. they provide measurable player advantage), we’ll take action based on the stance we just discussed.
>

Which means they are allowed, but you "use them at your own risk."

And since deleting sound files would **_NEVER_** "provide measurable player advantage" wouldn't that also mean that it's pretty much impossible to ever get banned for it? (Especially since he's literally deleting the files himself, so there's a 0% chance of having other mods/viruses "bundled" with it, since he's not "installing" anything, he's just deleting the files himself)
if anything it would provide a measurable DIS-advantage.
